channel.title: Restarting server via java`
channel.description:
Hey guys,
How would one go about restarting a server with a class/jar file.
I understand it would be using "Runtime.getRuntime().exec" but can someone explain a little more on how I could get the file to run every X hours to restart a server while one is away from there pc.
Thanks.

item.title: Restarting server via java`
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

DealingRocks:

You know T X?

I’ve heard the name, but haven’t ever spoken with him or her unless they were under a different alias at the time. Judging from what’s been said regarding T X, I don’t mind having not met. I can only infer that T X had made the same bolded statement in my above post?

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting server via java`
item.dc:creator: @DealingRocks DealingRocks
item.description:
@DealingRocks wrote:

Zilent:

[quote=AtomicInt_]If the SERVER was programmed properly, you wouldn’t need to auto-restart it.

What say you about heap fragmentation that makes the application stop when it’s being compacted by the garbage collector? If I were to say, a restart should happen before the heap fragments to the point where a “stop the world” compaction takes place.

There is absolutely no way to “properly” stop that other than buying Azul System’s commercial VM and running their C4 collector, which would cost more than most people make in a year. The other way to fix it properly is to use a technology that doesn’t rely on a hack job garbage collector.[/quote]
You know T X?

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting server via java`
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

If the SERVER was programmed properly, you wouldn't need to auto-restart it.

What say you about heap fragmentation that makes the application stop when it’s being compacted by the garbage collector? If I were to say, a restart should happen before the heap fragments to the point where a “stop the world” compaction takes place.

There is absolutely no way to “properly” stop that other than buying Azul System’s commercial VM and running their C4 collector, which would cost more than most people make in a year. The other way to fix it properly is to use a technology that doesn’t rely on a hack job garbage collector.

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting server via java`
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Outspoken, post:4, topic:434000”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=534574.msg3924369#msg3924369 date=1330053654]

We referring as a community (which now that I think of it, its not really a community project or moparclassic would be up now). However, I could say “we” as the community slowly contributing throughout time slowly and surely. As for my contributions, I create problems just as much as I solve them.

Fresh dl of rsca was ran for a little over a week with an average of 80 players online without the need of a restart. I remember when rsc sources first held 100 players, what an accomplishment.

“We” implies those who fixed the leak. Did you have anything to do with it, as far as actually writing code and/or contributing any logic that helped fix the problem?
From your response I can gather that you didn’t. With that said, you cannot say “we”.

All of my aliases on mopar (that you know of) don’t suggest I have contributed to rscd. You’re right.
[/quote]

I’m very aware of who you are, and your previous alias’s. You’re actually one of the few that I dislike for many reasons at this site. To close, don’t attempt to take any type of credit for work that you have not contributed to. That is all.[/quote]

and repeat.

Read full topic

Fresh dl of rsca was ran for a little over a week with an average of 80 players online without the need of a restart. I remember when rsc sources first held 100 players, what an accomplishment.

item.title: Restarting server via java`
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

Restarter jar - http://speedy.sh/ZY8Fq/restarter.jar

Goto public void Kill() method in LS / GS continents

And add:
System.exit(-1);

This is too exit the java process.

Put the Restarter.jar in the server source dir.

Use runls & runserver.bat for it to work.
The Restarter restarts your server automaticly 2 times a day (10.00 & 23.00).

Read full topic
